text:
There is a DOMConfigurator.configure(Element) static method. So, why not 
DOMConfigurator.doConfigure(Element, Hierarchy).

All other DOMConfigurator.configure() methods have a corresponding doConfigure. 
(BTW, the inverse is not true. There is no DOMConfigurator.configure
(InputStream)).

Workaround is to dump the DOM tree to a byte array and then use the InputStream 
version. Or, only use the default hierarchy.
